Seni beÄŸendiÄŸimi hissediyordum, ama kendime bunun sadece arkadaÅŸlÄ±k olduÄŸunu sÃ¶ylÃ¼yordum ve seninle Lucy arasÄ±nda karÅŸÄ±laÅŸtÄ±rma yapmaya baÅŸlayÄ±ncaya kadar ne kadar ilerlemiÅŸ olduÄŸumu bilmiyordum. Bundan sonra, sanÄ±rÄ±m, Sussex'de fazla kalmakla hata ettim ve bunun uygunluÄŸu konusunda kendime yaptÄ±ÄŸÄ±m aÃ§Ä±klamalar ÅŸunlardan daha iyi deÄŸildi: -Tehlike bana ait; kendimden baÅŸka kimseye zarar vermiyorum.
tr_translation: "I was so naive that I thought there could be no danger in being with you because my loyalty belonged to someone else; knowing my companionship would keep my heart as safe and untouchable as my honor. I felt that I liked you, but I kept telling myself it was just friendship, and I didn't realize how far I had progressed until I started comparing you with Lucy. After that, I think I made a mistake by staying too long in Sussex, and the explanations I gave myself about its appropriateness were no better than these: -The danger is mine; I am not harming anyone but myself."

vi_translation: - I was too simple-minded to think that my fidelity, which had been promised to another, posed no danger when I was near you; and that my sense of commitment would keep my heart as safe and sacred as my honor. I thought I liked you, but I told myself it was just friendship, and until I began to compare you with Lucy, I didn't realize how far I had gone. I think, afterwards, I was wrong to stay in Sussex for so long, and the reasoning I gave myself was this: 'The danger is mine; I am only hurting myself and not harming anyone else.'

en: "You may certainly ask to be forgiven," said Elinor, "because you have offended;â€”and I should think you might NOW venture so far as to profess some concern for having ever formed the engagement which drew on you your mother's anger."

es_translation: â€”You may well ask for forgiveness â€”said Elinorâ€”, because you have offended; and I would think that now you might even express some regret for having made the commitment that aroused your mother's anger.

tr_translation: "Of course, you may want to be forgiven," said Elinor, "because you have offended; -in fact, I think you might even try to express your regret for the words that upset your mother.""

vi_translation: Elinor said: - Surely you can ask for forgiveness for having offended; and I think now you can go a bit further to say you're sorry for having had an engagement that made your mother angry.

en: Marianne Dashwood was born to an extraordinary fate. She was born to discover the falsehood of her own opinions, and to counteract, by her conduct, her most favourite maxims. She was born to overcome an affection formed so late in life as at seventeen, and with no sentiment superior to strong esteem and lively friendship, voluntarily to give her hand to another!â€”and THAT other, a man who had suffered no less than herself under the event of a former attachment, whom, two years before, she had considered too old to be married,â€”and who still sought the constitutional safeguard of a flannel waistcoat!
es: Marianne Dashwood habÃ­a nacido destinada a algo extraordinario. NaciÃ³ para descubrir la falsedad de sus propias opiniones y para impugnar con su proceder sus mÃ¡ximas favoritas. NaciÃ³ para vencer un afecto surgido a la edad de diecisiete aÃ±os, y sin ningÃºn sentimiento superior a un gran aprecio y una profunda amistad, Â¡voluntariamente le entregÃ³ su mano a otro! Y ese otro era un hombre que habÃ­a sufrido no menos que ella con ocasiÃ³n de un antiguo afecto; a quien dos aÃ±os antes habÃ­a considerado demasiado viejo para el matrimonio, Â¡y que todavÃ­a buscaba proteger su salud con una camiseta de franela!
es_translation: Marianne Dashwood had been born destined for something extraordinary. She was born to discover the falseness of her own opinions and to challenge her favorite maxims with her actions. She was born to overcome an affection that arose at the age of seventeen, and without any feeling superior to great appreciation and deep friendship, she voluntarily gave her hand to another! And that other was a man who had suffered no less than she had due to an old affection; whom she had considered too old for marriage two years earlier, and who still sought to protect his health with a flannel shirt!

tr_translation: Marianne Dashwood was born with an extraordinary fate. She was born to see the error of her views and to invalidate her favorite maxims with her actions. She was born to overcome the love she held at the advanced age of seventeen, and to willingly give her hand to another with feelings that were not superior to strong respect and cheerful friendship! -and that other person, who had suffered at least as much as she had from a previous relationship, a man she found too old to marry two years ago, -and who still sought the comfort of woolen vests for his health!

vi_translation: Marianne Daswood was born into an extraordinary fate. She was born to discover that her notions were misguided, and to go against the principles she held most dear. She was born to overcome a blossoming love at the age of seventeen with no higher emotion than intense and vivid affection, and then willingly give her life to another! And this other person, who suffered no less than she did through the first love, whom she considered too old two years ago, is the one who still finds warmth in a flannel coat!
